org.divxdede.swing

Class ColorUtilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.divxdede.swing.ColorUtilities

  • public class ColorUtilities
extends Object
    Color Utilities helping you to derive colors on a brighter or darker forms.
    Theses implementations convert colors into a HSL color model and increase or decrease the lightness.

    The main difference using a HSL color model instead of HSB is that a pure blue color (0,0,255) can be brightned.
    With an HSB, a pure blue remain a pure blue even the factor used (like the Color.brighter() result.

    Author:
    André Sébastien (divxdede), Romain Guy (HSLtoRGB part taken from swing-x library)

    • Method Detail

      • brighter

        public static Color brighter(Color color)
        Creates a new Color that is a brighter version of the specified Color.

        This method convert color's RGB components into an HSL color model.
        After what the Lightness component is increased of 25.1% (BLACK is brightned to GRAY)

        Be carefull, this method don't provide same result than the Color.brighter() method.

        Returns:
        a new Color object that is a brighter version of the specified Color.

      • brighter

        public static Color brighter(Color color,
             float factor)
        Creates a new Color that is a brighter version of the specified Color.

        This method convert color's RGB components into an HSL color model.
        After what the Lightness component is increased with the specified factor (lightness = lightness * (1+factor))

        • A factor of 0.0f will result in the same color as the original.
        • A factor of 1.0f will result in the WHITE color

        Be carefull, this method don't provide same result than the Color.brighter() method.

        Returns:
        a new Color object that is a brighter version of the specified Color.

      • darker

        public static Color darker(Color color)
        Creates a new Color that is a darker version of the specified Color.

        This method convert color's RGB components into an HSL color model.
        After what the Lightness component is decreased of 25.1%

        Be carefull, this method don't provide same result than the Color.darker() method.

        Returns:
        a new Color object that is a darker version of the specified Color.

      • darker

        public static Color darker(Color color,
           float factor)
        Creates a new Color that is a darker version of the specified Color.

        This method convert color's RGB components into an HSL color model.
        After what the Lightness component is decreased with the specified factor (lightness = lightness * (1-factor))

        • A factor of 0.0f will result in the same color as the original.
        • A factor of 1.0f will result in the BLACK color

        Be carefull, this method don't provide same result than the Color.darker() method.

        Returns:
        a new Color object that is a darker version of the specified Color.

      • translucent

        public static Color translucent(Color color,
                int alpha)
        Derive a color to a translucent color.
        Create a color from another one by replacing the alpha channel but keeping rgb components.
        Parameters:
        color - Color to derive.
        alpha - Alpha to use on the new derivated color. The alpha channel mst be in range [0 ~ 255]. 255 means an opaque color
        Returns:
        The translucent color
        Since:
        0.2
